ISSUE.TITLE: Datetime format on CSV is different.
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: Re-opening from issue #2557 since it otherwise is the same situation we are in: --- Issue Summary When I download CSV file on the queries page, the datetime format that CSV has is not as same as an original data. is this a bug or a feature? Original data on MySQL is "2018-01-23 14:00:30" Redash CSV is "2018-01-23T14:00:30" I'd like to get rid of "T". Redash Version: redash:4.0.0-rc.1 Browser/OS: Chrome How did you install Redash: Docker --- Now I did see the workaround for this: `SELECT DATE_FORMAT(NOW(), '%Y-%m-%d %H:%i:%s') now;` However as we use Redash across many queries with many people it would seem a bit silly to have everyone use the workaround since it otherwise is not an issue if used directly with the database. Is there a global environment setting or something we can change to make ReDash not put the T in the date format? Thanks!
